full_summary:
====================

### Tender Notice for High Voltage Infrastructure Electrical Services

#### Project Overview

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada's Lethbridge Research and Development Centre is soliciting proposals from qualified contractors to provide high voltage infrastructure electrical services on an as-and-when-requested basis.

#### Background

The Centre requires a contractor to deliver electrical services to the identified users. The contract will be for a period of one calendar year with the possibility of extending for three additional 1-year periods. The anticipated start date is September 1, 2024.

#### Mandatory Security Requirements

All bidders and their employees must not have unescorted access to Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada premises. They must always be escorted by the project authority or a suitable replacement appointed by the project authority.

#### Site Visit Information (Optional)

A site visit is recommended for interested bidders. The visit will take place on Tuesday, July 9, 2024, at 10:00 am MDT. Bidders must confirm their attendance and provide the names of the persons attending by Monday, July 8, 2024, at 12:00 pm MDT.

#### Tender Requirements

Bids will be evaluated based on the entire requirement of the bid solicitation, including technical and financial evaluation criteria. The contract will be awarded to the responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price.

#### Procurement Details

Bidders must submit their proposals electronically through the Canada Post Corporation's CPC Connect service. The bids must be submitted to Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada's Bid Receiving Unit by the closing date and time indicated in the bid solicitation.

#### Contact Information

For any questions or concerns, please contact Natalie O'Neill, Contracting Specialist, at natalie.oneill@agr.gc.ca or (306) 807-8740.

#### Tender Documents

The tender documents, including the bid solicitation, can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities.

#### Integrity Regime

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada has adopted the Integrity Regime, administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. This means that the integrity provisions are being applied in our procurement activities.

Please note that the federal Indigenous Business Directory is an online resource for identifying Indigenous business capacity. Having a business profile in the directory can increase business visibility and provide additional opportunities. For more information, please visit www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory. Philosoph
